Complaints.description: Submit a complaint using the form below. All fields are required.

SickAndPainForm.description: Report a sick or pain case using the form below. All fields are required.

Cancelations.description: Submit a cancelation using the form below. All fields are required.

hipaa_overview.description: HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) is a federal law that protects patient health information (PHI). All staff must comply to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability of patient data.

key_principles.description: Only access or share the minimum necessary patient information required to complete a task.
Patients have the right to access their records, request corrections, and know who has accessed their information.
Do not discuss patient information in public areas or with unauthorized persons.
Use secure passwords, log out of systems when not in use, and avoid using personal devices for PHI.
Report any breaches or suspected unauthorized disclosures to the compliance officer immediately.

common_violations: Leaving charts or computers with PHI unattended.
Discussing patient information in hallways or elevators.
Accessing records of patients not under your care.
Using unencrypted email to share PHI.
staff_responsibilities: Follow clinic's privacy and security policies.
Use only authorized communication channels for PHI.
Lock screens when away from workstations.

prescriptions.name: Lisinopril
prescriptions.description: Helps lower blood pressure by relaxing blood vessels and reducing strain on the heart.

prescriptions.name: Metformin
prescriptions.description: First-line medication for diabetes that helps lower blood sugar by reducing glucose production in the liver and improving insulin sensitivity.

prescriptions.name: Atorvastatin (Lipitor)
prescriptions.description: Lowers cholesterol levels and reduces risk of heart attack and stroke by blocking cholesterol production in the liver.

prescriptions.name: Levothyroxine (Synthroid)
prescriptions.description: Synthetic thyroid hormone replacement for patients whose thyroid gland doesn't produce enough hormone naturally.

prescriptions.name: Albuterol Inhaler (ProAir, Ventolin)
prescriptions.description: Quick-relief inhaler that opens airways during asthma attacks or breathing difficulties.

prescriptions.name: Amlodipine (Norvasc)
prescriptions.description: Relaxes blood vessels and improves blood flow, reducing blood pressure and chest pain.

prescriptions.name: Losartan (Cozaar)
prescriptions.description: Lowers blood pressure and protects kidneys, especially beneficial for diabetic patients.

prescriptions.name: Omeprazole (Prilosec)
prescriptions.description: Reduces stomach acid production to treat heartburn, ulcers, and acid-related digestive problems.

prescriptions.name: Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ)
prescriptions.description: Water pill that helps kidneys remove excess salt and water, lowering blood pressure.

prescriptions.name: Sertraline (Zoloft)
prescriptions.description: Improves mood and reduces anxiety by balancing serotonin levels in the brain.

prescriptions.name: Prednisone
prescriptions.description: Powerful anti-inflammatory medication used for severe allergies, arthritis, and immune system disorders.

prescriptions.name: Gabapentin (Neurontin)
prescriptions.indication: Nerve pain, seizures, restless leg syndrome
prescriptions.description: Treats nerve pain and seizures by affecting nerve signals in the brain and spinal cord.

prescriptions.name: Ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin)
prescriptions.description: Over-the-counter pain reliever that reduces inflammation, pain, and fever.

prescriptions.name: Amoxicillin
prescriptions.description: Antibiotic used to treat various bacterial infections including respiratory, skin, and urinary tract infections.

prescriptions.name: Warfarin (Coumadin)
prescriptions.description: Prevents blood clots by interfering with vitamin K-dependent clotting factors; requires regular monitoring.

Emergency_Triage_Guide.description: A comprehensive guide to help distinguish between sick/pain patients who can wait for regular appointments versus those requiring immediate emergency care.

regular_sick_symptoms.details: Mild runny nose, low-grade fever (under 101°F), minor cough without breathing difficulty
Nausea without severe pain, mild diarrhea, minor indigestion
Small wounds that are not deep, minimal bleeding that stops with pressure
Mild to moderate pain (1-6 on pain scale) that's manageable and not worsening

urgent_but_not_emergency.details: Fever 101-102°F with mild symptoms, patient is alert and responsive
Cough lasting several days but no breathing difficulty or chest pain
Sprains, minor cuts that may need stitches but bleeding is controlled

immediate_emergency_referral.details: Pain radiating to arm, jaw, or back, especially with shortness of breath or sweating
Unable to speak in full sentences, gasping for air, blue lips or fingernails
Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call 911
Pain 8-10/10, rigid abdomen, vomiting blood, signs of internal bleeding
Fever above 103°F with altered mental status, seizures, or severe headache
Head injury with loss of consciousness, major bleeding, suspected fractures
Any mention of self-harm or suicidal ideation
Difficulty breathing, swelling of face/throat, widespread rash with breathing issues

red_flag_questions: Are you having any chest pain or pressure?
Are you having trouble breathing or catching your breath?
Do you have any sudden weakness in your face, arm, or leg?
Is your speech slurred or difficult to understand?
Are you having the worst headache of your life?
Are you vomiting blood or having bloody stools?
Have you lost consciousness or had a seizure?
Are you having thoughts of hurting yourself or others?
Emergency_Triage_Guide.documentation_requirements: Always document the specific symptoms reported, the assessment level (regular/urgent/emergency), and the action taken. Include time stamps and your name for all emergency referrals.

insurance_and_billing.uninsured: Self-pay fee of $150 for base visit
